tool.name: SAGA.shapes_points.3
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayPOINTS False isArrayID_POINTS False isArrayNEAR False isArrayID_NEAR False output_data_DISTANCES $output_data_DISTANCES name SAGA.shapes_points.3 POINTS $POINTS ID_POINTS $ID_POINTS NEAR $NEAR ID_NEAR $ID_NEAR FORMAT $FORMAT MAX_DIST $MAX_DIST prefer $prefer response $response outputType_DISTANCES $OutputSection_DISTANCES.outputType_DISTANCES transmissionMode_DISTANCES $OutputSection_DISTANCES.transmissionMode_DISTANCES

param.name: POINTS
param.label: Points
param.help: Points The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, xml, json

param.name: ID_POINTS
param.label: Identifier
param.help: Identifier The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: NEAR
param.label: Near Points
param.help: Near Points The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, xml, json

param.name: ID_NEAR
param.label: Identifier
param.help: Identifier The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FORMAT
param.label: Output Format
param.option: complete input times near points matrix
each pair with a single record

param.name: MAX_DIST
param.label: Maximum Distance
param.help: ignored if set to zero (consider all pairs)

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_DISTANCES
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: Computes distances between pairs of points.
